title: Madeleine McCann’s parents shut down Facebook page after "hateful" messages from trolls
text:

The official Facebook page behind the search for Madeleine McCann was shut down last night following "hateful" messages from trolls. 
In a post, the administrator of the "Official Find Madeleine Campaign" page said they needed to "take a break" and "clear" their head. 
They wrote: "The trolls and the media encouraging them with false stories are taking a toll on my mental health. Be back in a few days." 
The page, endorsed by the McCanns and followed by hundreds of thousands of people, has since gone back online. 
However, the administrator warned that it will keep being unpublished if trolls continue to post such messages. Maddie vanished from a holiday apartment in Portugal’s Praia da Luz in May 2007 (Photo: PA) 
They wrote: "I have turned the page back on for now, but will continue to turn the page off if we receive hateful posts. 
"I need to do this for my own mental health." 
They added that they would like to "set the record straight" on how the Facebook page is managed. Read More Kate and Gerry McCann hit back at Marco Pierre White Jr after his foul-mouthed rant about Madeleine 
The page was set up in May 2007, shortly after Maddie vanished from a holiday apartment in Portugal’s Praia da Luz. 
At the time, the little girl was just three years old and her parents, Kate and Gerry, were dining nearby with friends.
